fact_text: On 20 December 1951, in the remote town of Arco, Idaho, the Experimental Breeder Reactor I quietly made history by becoming the first nuclear power plant to generate electricity—just enough to light four humble bulbs. Those small glowing filaments marked a threshold moment, transforming the abstract terror and promise of the atom into a tangible, man-made star burning indoors.

episode.title: Morning Drops #05 - Electric Shock
episode.description: An energizing episode with electrifying sounds to wake you up and get you moving. High energy tracks that deliver a jolt of musical electricity to start your day.

match_reason: The first nuclear plant lighting four bulbs is essentially humanity’s original controlled "electric shock" from the atom—small, experimental, but charged with possibility. Episode #05 mirrors that moment with high-voltage guitars and crackling energy, turning the birth of nuclear electricity into a blues-rock surge that feels like plugging Earth’s early atomic glow straight into an amplifier.
